Life & Letters Fall 2016

Illustrations commissioned for UT's Liberal Arts Magazine. | January 13, 2017 | 11:00

Here’s an unexpected project. As I was recovering from the intense Impact Report, I was given what seemed like a tiny assignment for UT’s own Liberal Arts Magazine. No, I was not given the cover of Life & Letters—thanks for nothing Jun Cen—but the editorial illustration has been a worthwhile experience I hope to pursue in the future.

<source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-1008by756-2a463c.webp" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-1008by756-2a463c.jpg" media="(min-width: 42em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 42em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-672by504-2a463c.webp" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-672by504-2a463c.jpg" media="(min-width: 42em)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-621by466-2a463c.webp" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-621by466-2a463c.jpg" media="(min-width: 32em) and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-width: 32em) and (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-414by311-2a463c.webp" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-414by311-2a463c.jpg" media="(min-width: 32em)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-483by362-2a463c.webp" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-483by362-2a463c.jpg" media="(-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 1.5), (min-resolution: 144dpi)"type="image/jpeg"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-322by242-2a463c.webp"type="image/webp"> <source data-srcset="http://localhost:4000/generated/ll1-322by242-2a463c.jpg"type="image/jpeg">

Here’s a little collab between Allen Quigley and me. He covered the colors while I created the icons.

The assignments kept coming, and I felt this illustration of a map girl beckoned back to an older style.

Benny Franks has seen better days, but I believe this quick illustration turned out well.

On the bottom left corner you will find another quick illustration. Notice the coat hanger question mark— perhaps it’s too subtle!
